Stefan bringt es auf den Punkt - Bei diesem Irrsinn zu behaupten, man habe wissenschaftliche Studien durchgeführt, ist absolut krank im Kopf 🤬

Inhalt:
➡️ Die Adjuvantien, fälschlicherweise als Hilfsstoffe in Impfstoffen bezeichnet, sind unheimlich gefährlich

➡️ Keine einzige mRNA-Impfung hat jemals in Tierversuchen funktioniert - IM GEGENTEIL!

➡️ In allen Impfstoffstudien werden keine Placebo-Studien durchgeführt - In der Placebogruppe sind die sogenannten Adjuvantien (Hilfssubstanzen) immer enthalten.

➡️ Diese Studien werden in den ärmsten Ländern durchgeführt, bei denen keiner etwas mitbekommt.

Einfügung (JWD): Wenn die von Dr. Jane Ruby präsentierte Meldung, - "UAL-Forscher in Spanien decken die tatsächlichen Inhaltsstoffe im Pfizer-Biontech Impfstoff auf" - zutrifft, dann bestehen die Corona-Impfstoffe fast zu 100% aus Adjuvantien in Form von Graphenoxid-Nanopartikeln. Was wiederum klar macht, dass die Reise in Richtung "Transhumanismus", zu menschlichen Robotern gehen soll.

Day 108 of asking for the return of Scishow Quizshow

How is it possible that in every single episode of SciShow recently there is some kind of animal torture in the name of research in there somewhere - even something as innocuous as how animals store food for the winter? And never, not once, an acknowledgement of the pain suffered or lives lost.
I understand that there are times, especially in the case of medical advancement, when perhaps there's no choice - but I don't understand never weighing the value of the experiment... I don't understand the absolute disregard for creatures that we know feel pain, have thoughts, form communities. Shouldn't the ethics of causing pain or death to answer a question at least be at least considered? It's not 1910 anymore.

Squirrels are urban gardeners!! I always cut back on feeding the squirrels at fall. So they can hide the walnuts from my backyard tree. It's good that they can have a back up storage. And during winter, I do end up putting out shell peanuts for the squirrels to find when digging in the snow while they search. The loose seed and nuts I throw out are for the birds and chipmunks. A mix for everyone though. Usually toss before the sun comes up. That way they eat early to help raise their body temp during the cold winter months. There is so much wildlife in our neighborhood. And competition for food gets crazy. Besides that I really enjoy watching them while having coffee. It's the little things...

One spring I found a tiny birds nest that was filled with safflower seed from my bird feeder. There are lots of chickadees here so I wonder if they are the ones who stashed the seed. But I have also found stashes of seed inside my charcoal grill & inside an upside down clay flower pot. One year I found a stash of corn seeds in my car. I suppose chickadees could have squeezed inside the grill or through the drainage hole in the pot. But no way they could have gotten to my car parked in the garage.
